metadata.Title: CVE-2019-13734 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Out of bounds write in SQLite in Google Chrome prior to 79.0.3945.79 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-13734` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 79.0.3945.79-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 79.0.3945.79-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 79.0.3945.79-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 79.0.3945.79-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 79.0.3945.79-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

lemon - 3.31.1-1ubuntu1
libsqlite3-0 - 3.31.1-1ubuntu1
libsqlite3-tcl - 3.31.1-1ubuntu1
sqlite3 - 3.31.1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '79.0.3945.79-0ubuntu1').
sqlite package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
sqlite3 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.31.1-1ubuntu1').
